--- title: Select --- {/* */} ## Features - Set a list of element types to remove on delete. ## Installation ```bash npm install @udecode/plate-select ``` ## Usage ```tsx import { DeletePlugin } from '@udecode/plate'; ``` ```tsx const plugins = [ // ...otherPlugins, DeletePlugin, ]; ``` ## Default Behavior ### Select on Backspace By default, when you press backspace at the start of a block, if the preceding block is a void block (like an image or a horizontal rule), Plate will automatically select that void block. If the current block is empty, it will be removed before the selection happens. This behavior is built-in and does not require any configuration. ```tsx // Empty paragraph after an image

// Pressing backspace will select the image and remove the empty paragraph. ``` ## Plugins ### `DeletePlugin` Plugin that removes empty blocks when pressing delete (forward delete) if they match the query options. Query options to filter which empty blocks can be removed. - **Default:** `{ allow: ['p'] }` Example: ```tsx const plugins = [ DeletePlugin.configure({ options: { // Only remove empty paragraphs and blockquotes query: { allow: ['p', 'blockquote'], }, }, }), ]; ``` Behavior: 1. Check if current block is empty and matches query options 2. If true: Remove entire block 3. If false: Use default delete behavior ```tsx // Empty paragraph followed by code block

test // Pressing delete will remove the empty paragraph instead of nothing test ``` ```tsx const plugins = [ // ...otherPlugins, DeletePlugin, ];
